title: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: In JDK 1.4, the All Types dialog contains obfuscated classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', and so on. These classes are not expected to be displayed in the dialog as they are obfuscated and not user-friendly.
OB: Obfuscated classes like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc., are prominently visible in the Open Type dialog.
EB: Obfuscated classes should not be displayed in the Open Type dialog.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Open the All Types dialog in JDK 1.4. 
2. Observe that obfuscated classes like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd' are displayed in the dialog.
